page.title: 15JAMES HOPE AND THE PRESENT
page.content: Jemmy Hope's grave is in the Mallusk graveyard.Roughfort is still the same today as it was in Jemmy Hope's day. Old weapons are sometimes found in old thatched cottages when they are being demolished.The most beautiful monument of the rebellion is an old oak tree, which is said to have been planted on the first year of the rising.It stands opposite the "Ou'l Fort" with its head held high in defiance. The 19th and 20th centuarys saw the area provide employment in the local linen mills,enjoy the relative prosperity that this thriving Ulster business brought and suffer as the linen trade declined. In 1958,Newtownabbey Urban District Council was set up and in 1973 the status was changed.It became Newtownabbey District Council without any alterations to our assigned area.
